validation.domain-validation: Use the following URL format: example.com
validation.https-validation: Should be a valid https URL
validation.url-check-health: You entered the wrong network address or the block height on your endpoint is far behind
validation.ip-validation: Should be a valid IP address
validation.public-url-validation: Should not be a public endpoint of Ankr
validation.premium-url-validation: Should not be a premium endpoint of Ankr
validation.duplicate-url-validation: This endpoint has already been added

signup-modal.title: Sign up method
signup-modal.description: By continuing you agree to our terms of service and privacy policy.
signup-modal.email-warning: Please connect using Google only if you haven’t used a wallet to sign in previously

chains.title: Choose Your Network
chains.archive-tooltip-text: Archived Mode makes it possible to reference a complete history of data kept on full nodes stretching back to the genesis block. This is necessary to complete queries to a distant historical state, such as a past account balance at block #4,000,000. It is especially useful for services like block explorers, wallet vendors, and chain analytics.

banner.dashboard:
If your volume exceeds 1M daily requests, our enterprise-grade service is for you.
Contact us and switch to fast, secure, and dedicated infrastructure. Contact sales@ankr.com

header.private-endpoints-tooltip: Use Provider URL as your main API endpoint for development. Do not use "My Endpoints" directly.
header.public-endpoints-tooltip: Use Provider URL as your main API endpoint for development.

about-tron.about: The new TronGrid REST API provides user-friendly read APIs with significantly reduced latency, improved consistency, improved availability, and added partition tolerance.

no-data.title: Send your request
no-data.content: Once you start sending requests, your activity will be visible here.

method-description.web3_sha3: Returns Keccak-256 (not the standardized SHA3-256) of the given data.
method-description.net_listening: Returns `true` if client is actively listening for network connections.
method-description.net_peerCount: Returns number of peers currently connected to the client.
method-description.eth_protocolVersion: Returns the current ethereum protocol version.
method-description.eth_syncing: Returns an object with data about the sync status or false.
method-description.eth_mining: Returns `true` if client is actively mining new blocks.
method-description.eth_hashrate: Returns the number of hashes per second that the node is mining with.
method-description.eth_gasPrice: Returns the current price per gas in wei.
method-description.eth_accounts: Returns a list of addresses owned by client.
method-description.eth_blockNumber: Returns the number of most recent block.
method-description.eth_getBalance: Returns the balance of the account of given address.
method-description.eth_getStorageAt: Returns the value from a storage position at a given address.
method-description.eth_getTransactionCount: Returns the number of transactions sent from an address.
method-description.eth_getBlockTransactionCountByHash: Returns the number of transactions in a block from a block matching the given block hash.
method-description.eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber: Returns the number of transactions in a block matching the given block number.
method-description.eth_getUncleCountByBlockHash: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block hash.
method-description.eth_getUncleCountByBlockNumber: Returns the number of uncles in a block from a block matching the given block number.
method-description.eth_getCode: Returns code at a given address.
method-description.eth_sendRawTransaction: Creates new message call transaction or a contract creation for signed transactions.
method-description.eth_call: Call any read-only function on a deployed contract
method-description.eth_estimateGas: 🚫 This method is not YET supported!
method-description.eth_getBlockByHash: Returns information about a block by hash.
method-description.eth_getBlockByNumber: Returns information about a block by block number.
method-description.eth_getTransactionByHash: Returns the information about a transaction requested by transaction hash.
method-description.eth_getTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex: Returns information about a transaction by block hash and transaction index position.
method-description.eth_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex: Returns information about a transaction by block number and transaction index position.
method-description.eth_getTransactionReceipt: Returns the receipt of a transaction by transaction hash.
method-description.eth_getUncleByBlockHashAndIndex: Returns information about a uncle of a block by hash and uncle index position.
method-description.eth_getUncleByBlockNumberAndIndex: Returns information about a uncle of a block by number and uncle index position.
method-description.eth_getCompilers: Returns a list of available compilers in the client.
method-description.eth_newFilter: Creates a filter object, based on filter options, to notify when the state changes (logs).  The resulting value from the filter is immediately returned using `eth_getFilterChanges`.
method-description.eth_newBlockFilter: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when a new block arrives. The resulting value from the filter is immediately returned using `eth_getFilterChanges`.
method-description.eth_newPendingTransactionFilter: Creates a filter in the node, to notify when new pending transactions arrive. The resulting value from the filter is immediately returned using `eth_getFilterChanges`.
method-description.eth_uninstallFilter: 🚫 This method is not YET supported!
method-description.eth_getFilterChanges: This method is covered by eth_newFilter, eth_newBlockFilter and eth_newPendingTransactionFilter.
method-description.eth_getFilterLogs: This method is covered by eth_newFilter, eth_newBlockFilter and eth_newPendingTransactionFilter.
method-description.eth_getLogs: This method is covered by eth_newFilter, eth_newBlockFilter and eth_newPendingTransactionFilter.
method-description.eth_getWork: Returns the hash of the current block, the seedHash, and the boundary condition to be met ('target').
method-description.trace_block: Returns traces created at given block (OpenEthereum or Parity only).
method-description.trace_transaction: Returns all traces of given transaction (OpenEthereum or Parity only).
method-description.trace_get: Returns trace at given position (OpenEthereum or Parity only).
method-description.trace_rawTransaction: Traces a call to `eth_sendRawTransaction` without making the call, returning the traces.
method-description.trace_replayBlockTransactions: Replays all transactions in a block returning the requested traces for each transaction.
method-description.trace_replayTransaction: Replays a transaction, returning the traces.
method-description.trace_call: Executes the given call and returns a number of possible traces for it.

c-chain.getAtomicTx: Returns the transaction data of a provided transaction ID by calling the node's `getAtomicTx` method.
c-chain.export: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Export an asset from the C-Chain to X-Chain or P-Chain. After calling this method, you must call the X-Chain's avm.import or P-Chain's platform.import
c-chain.exportAVAX: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>DEPRECATED—instead use avax.export.
c-chain.exportKey: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Get the private key that controls a given address. The returned private key can be added to a user with avax.importKey.
c-chain.getUTXOs: Retrieves the UTXOs related to the addresses provided from the node's `getUTXOs` method.
c-chain.import: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Finalize the transfer of a non-AVAX or AVAX from X-Chain or P-Chain to the C-Chain. Before this method is called, you must call the X-Chain’s avm.export or P-Chain’s platform.exportAVAX with assetID AVAX to initiate the transfer.
c-chain.importAVAX: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>DEPRECATED—instead use avax.import
c-chain.importKey: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Give a user control over an address by providing the private key that controls the address.
c-chain.issueTx: Calls the node's issueTx method from the API and returns the resulting transaction ID as a string.
c-chain.getAtomicTxStatus: Returns the status of a provided atomic transaction ID by calling the node's `getAtomicTxStatus` method.

p-chain.addDelegator: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Add a delegator to the Primary Network.
p-chain.addValidator: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Add a validator to the Primary Network.
p-chain.addSubnetValidator: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Add a validator to a Subnet other than the Primary Network.
p-chain.createAddress: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Create a new address controlled by the given user.
p-chain.createBlockchain: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Create a new blockchain.
p-chain.createSubnet: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Create a new Subnet.
p-chain.exportAVAX: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Send AVAX from an address on the P-Chain to an address on the X-Chain or C-Chain.
p-chain.exportKey: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Get the private key that controls a given address.
p-chain.getBalance: Get the balance of AVAX controlled by a given address.
p-chain.getBlockchains: Get all the blockchains that exist (excluding the P-Chain).
p-chain.getBlockchainStatus: Get the status of a blockchain.
p-chain.getCurrentSupply: Returns an upper bound on the number of AVAX that exist.
p-chain.getCurrentValidators: List the current validators of the given Subnet.
p-chain.getHeight: Returns the height of the last accepted block.
p-chain.getMaxStakeAmount: Returns the maximum amount of nAVAX staking to the named node during a particular time period.
p-chain.getMinStake: Get the minimum amount of AVAX required to validate the Primary Network and the minimum amount of AVAX that can be delegated.
p-chain.getPendingValidators: List the validators in the pending validator set of the specified Subnet. Each validator is not currently validating the Subnet but will in the future.
p-chain.getRewardUTXOs: Returns the UTXOs that were rewarded after the provided transaction's staking or delegation period ended.
p-chain.getStakingAssetID: Retrieve an assetID for a subnet’s staking asset. Currently, this only returns the Primary Network’s staking assetID.
p-chain.getStake: Get the amount of nAVAX staked by a set of addresses. The amount returned does not include staking rewards.
p-chain.getTotalStake: Get the total amount of nAVAX staked on the Primary Network.
p-chain.getTx: Gets a transaction by its ID.
p-chain.getTxStatus: Gets a transaction’s status by its ID.
p-chain.getUTXOs: Gets the UTXOs that reference a given set of addresses.
p-chain.getValidatorsAt: Get the validators and their weights of a Subnet or the Primary Network at a given P-Chain height.
p-chain.importAVAX: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Complete a transfer of AVAX from the X-Chain, or C-Chain to the P-Chain.
p-chain.importKey: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Give a user control over an address by providing the private key that controls the address.
p-chain.issueTx: Issue a transaction to the Platform Chain.
p-chain.listAddresses: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>List addresses controlled by the given user.
p-chain.sampleValidators: Sample validators from the specified Subnet.
p-chain.validatedBy: Get the Subnet that validates a given blockchain.
p-chain.validates: Get the IDs of the blockchains a Subnet validates.

x-chain.buildGenesis: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>A JSON representing the genesis data
x-chain.createAddress: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Create a new address controlled by the given user.
x-chain.createFixedCapAsset: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Create a new fixed-cap, fungible asset.
x-chain.mint: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Mint units of a variable-cap asset created with avm.createVariableCapAsset
x-chain.createVariableCapAsset: Create a new variable-cap, fungible asset.
x-chain.createNFTAsset: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Create a new non-fungible asset.
x-chain.mintNFT: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Mint non-fungible tokens which were created with avm.createNFTAsset
x-chain.export: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Send an asset from the X-Chain to the P-Chain or C-Chain.
x-chain.exportKey: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Get the private key that controls a given address.
x-chain.getAllBalances: Get the balances of all assets controlled by a given address.
x-chain.getBalance: Get the balance of an asset controlled by a given address.
x-chain.getAddressTxs: Returns all transactions that change the balance of the given address.
x-chain.getTxStatus: Get the status of a transaction sent to the network.
x-chain.getUTXOs: Gets the UTXOs that reference a given address.
x-chain.import: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Finalize a transfer of an asset from the P-Chain or C-Chain to the X-Chain.
x-chain.importKey: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Give a user control over an address by providing the private key that controls the address.
x-chain.issueTx: Send a signed transaction to the network.
x-chain.listAddresses: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>List addresses controlled by the given user.
x-chain.send: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>List addresses controlled by the given user.
x-chain.sendMultiple: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Sends multiple transfers of amount of assetID, to a specified address from a list of owned addresses.
x-chain.sendNFT: 🚫 This method is not supported!</br>Send a non-fungible token.

solana.getAccountInfo: Returns all information associated with the account of provided Pubkey
solana.getBalance: Returns the balance of the account of provided Pubkey
solana.getBlock: Returns identity and transaction information about a confirmed block in the ledger
solana.getBlockHeight: Returns the current block height of the node
solana.getBlockProduction: Returns recent block production information from the current or previous epoch
solana.getBlocks: Returns a list of confirmed blocks between two slots
solana.getBlockTime: Returns the estimated production time of a block
solana.getClusterNodes: Returns information about all the nodes participating in the cluster
solana.getEpochInfo: Returns information about the current epoch
solana.getEpochSchedule: Returns epoch schedule information from this cluster's genesis config
solana.getFeeForMessage: Get the fee the network will charge for a particular Message
solana.getFirstAvailableBlock: Returns the slot of the lowest confirmed block that has not been purged from the ledger
solana.getInflationReward: Returns the inflation / staking reward for a list of addresses for an epoch
solana.getLargestAccounts: Returns the 20 largest accounts, by lamport balance (results may be cached up to two hours)
solana.getLeaderSchedule: Returns the leader schedule for an epoch
solana.getMinimumBalanceForRentExemption: Returns minimum balance required to make account rent exempt
solana.getRecentPerformanceSamples: Returns a list of recent performance samples, in reverse slot order. Performance samples are taken every 60 seconds and include the number of transactions and slots that occur in a given time window.
solana.getSignaturesForAddress: Returns signatures for confirmed transactions that include the given address in their accountKeys list. Returns signatures backwards in time from the provided signature or most recent confirmed block
solana.getSignatureStatuses: Returns the statuses of a list of signatures
solana.getSlot: Returns the slot that has reached the given or default commitment level
solana.getSlotLeaders: Returns the slot leaders for a given slot range
solana.getStakeActivation: Returns epoch activation information for a stake account
solana.getStakeMinimumDelegation: Returns the stake minimum delegation, in lamports
solana.getSupply: Returns information about the current supply
solana.getTokenAccountBalance: Returns the token balance of an SPL Token account
solana.getTokenAccountsByOwner: Returns all SPL Token accounts by token owner
solana.getTokenLargestAccounts: Returns the 20 largest accounts of a particular SPL Token type
solana.getTokenSupply: Returns the total supply of an SPL Token type
solana.getTransaction: Returns transaction details for a confirmed transaction
solana.getTransactionCount: Returns the current Transaction count from the ledger
solana.getVersion: Returns the current solana versions running on the node
solana.getVoteAccounts: Returns the account info and associated stake for all the voting accounts in the current bank
solana.requestAirdrop: Requests an airdrop of lamports to a Pubkey

near-api-js.query: Query the RPC by passing an RpcQueryRequest.
near-api-js.query - view_access_key: Returns information about a single access key for given account.
near-api-js.query - view_access_key_list: You can query all access keys for a given account.
near-api-js.EXPERIMENTAL_changes - single_access_key: Returns individual access key changes in a specific block. You can query multiple keys by passing an array of objects containing the account_id and public_key.
near-api-js.EXPERIMENTAL_changes - all_access_key_ch: Returns changes to all access keys of a specific block. Multiple accounts can be queried by passing an array of account_ids.
near-api-js.EXPERIMENTAL_changes - account_changes: Returns account changes from transactions in a given account.
near-api-js.query - view_code: Returns the contract code (Wasm binary) deployed to the account. Please note that the returned code will be encoded in base64.
near-api-js.query - view_state: Returns the state (key value pairs) of a contract based on the key prefix (base64 encoded). Pass an empty string for prefix_base64 if you would like to return the entire state. Please note that the returned state will be base64 encoded as well.
near-api-js.EXPERIMENTAL_changes - data_changes: Returns the state change details of a contract based on the key prefix (encoded to base64). Pass an empty string for this param if you would like to return all state changes.
near-api-js.EXPERIMENTAL_changes - contract_code_cha: Returns code changes made when deploying a contract. Change is returned is a base64 encoded WASM file.
near-api-js.query - call_function: Allows you to call a contract method as a view function.
near-api-js.block: Queries network and returns block for given height or hash. You can also use finality param to return latest block details.
near-api-js.EXPERIMENTAL_changes_in_block: Returns changes in block for given height or hash. You can also use finality param to return latest block details.
near-api-js.chunk: Returns details of a specific chunk. You can run a block details query to get a valid chunk hash.
near-api-js.gas_price: Returns gas price for a specific block_height or block_hash.
near-api-js.EXPERIMENTAL_protocol_config: Returns most recent protocol configuration or a specific queried block. Useful for finding current storage and transaction costs.
near-api-js.validators: Queries active validators on the network returning details and the state of validation on the blockchain.
near-api-js.broadcast_tx_async: Sends a transaction and immediately returns transaction hash.
near-api-js.broadcast_tx_commit: Sends a transaction and waits until transaction is fully complete. (Has a 10 second timeout)
near-api-js.tx: Queries status of a transaction by hash and returns the final transaction result.
near-api-js.EXPERIMENTAL_tx_status: Queries status of a transaction by hash, returning the final transaction result and details of all receipts.
near-api-js.EXPERIMENTAL_receipt: Fetches a receipt by it's ID (as is, without a status or execution outcome)

tron.getblockbylimitnext: Query a list of blocks by range.
tron.broadcasthex: Broadcast transaction hex string after sign.
tron.createtransaction: Create a TRX transfer transaction. If to_address does not exist, then create the account on the blockchain.
tron.exchangetransaction: Participate the transaction of exchange pair.
tron.getblockbynum: Query a block information by block height.
tron.getblockbyid: Query a block information by block id.
tron.gettransactionbyid: Query a transaction information by transaction id.
tron.getaccountbalance: Get the account balance in a specific block.
tron.gettransactioncountbyblocknum: Query the number of transactions in a specific block.
tron.gettransactioninfobyblocknum: Query the list of transaction information in a specific block.
tron.getassetissuelist: Query the list of all the tokens.
tron.getpaginatedassetissuelist: Query the list of all the tokens by pagination.
tron.getpaginatedproposallist: Query the list of all the proposals by pagination.
tron.getpaginatedexchangelist: Query the list of all the exchange pairs by pagination.
tron.getproposalbyid: Query a proposal by proposal id.
tron.getaccountresource: Query the resource information of an account.
tron.getexchangebyid: Query an exchange pair by exchange pair id.
tron.listexchanges: Query the list of all the exchange pairs.
tron.getchainparameters: Query the parameters of the blockchain used for witnesses to create a proposal.
tron.getdelegatedresourceaccountindex: Query the energy delegation index by an account.
tron.getaccountbyid: Query an account information by account id.
tron.getdeferredtransactionbyid: Query the deferred transaction information by transaction id.
tron.getdeferredtransactioninfobyid: Query the deferred transaction fee, block height by transaction id.
tron.triggerconstantcontract: Trigger the constant of the smart contract, the transaction is off the blockchain.
tron.getmerkletreevoucherinfo: To get a merkle tree infromation of a note.
tron.easytransferbyprivate:
🚫 This method is not supported!
TRX Easy transfer.
tron.easytransferassetbyprivate:

tron.easytransfer:

tron.easytransferasset:

To sign a transaction.
tron.createaddress:

Create an address with a password.
tron.listnodes:

Query the list of nodes connected to the ip of the api.
tron.generateaddress:
🚫 This method is not supported!
Generate address and private key.
tron.getnodeinfo:

Query the current node information.
tron.addtransactionsign:

To sign the transaction of trigger constant contract.
tron.getakfromask:

To get ak key from ask key.
tron.getnkfromnsk:

To get nk key from nsk key.
tron.getspendingkey:

To get spending key.
tron.getexpandedspendingkey:

To create a signature for a transaction.

To create shielded transaction, please refer to The Demo.

create the shielded TRC-20 transaction parameters, which has three types: mint, transfer and burn.

harmony.hmyv2_call: Executes a new message call immediately without creating a transaction on the block chain.
harmony.hmyv2_estimateGas: Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete. The transaction will not be added to the blockchain.
harmony.hmyv2_getCode: Get the code at a specific address.
harmony.hmyv2_getStorageAt: Returns the value from a storage position at a given address.
harmony.hmyv2_getDelegationsByDelegator: Gets a list of delegations for a ONE delegator wallet address.
harmony.hmyv2_getDelegationsByValidator: Gets all delegations using the specified ONE address of the validator.
harmony.hmyv2_getAllValidatorInformation: Get staking validator information for all validators.
harmony.hmyv2_getAllValidatorInformationByBlockN: Get staking validator information snapshot for all validators by blocknum.
harmony.hmyv2_getCXReceiptByHash: Returns a cx receipt for the provided transaction hash.
harmony.hmyv2_getPendingCXReceipts: Returns an array of pending cx receipts in tx pool.
harmony.hmyv2_pendingTransactions: Returns a list of pending transactions.
harmony.hmyv2_getCurrentStakingErrorSink: Gets a list of failed transactions currently in the staking errors sink.
harmony.hmyv2_getStakingTransactionByBlockNumber: Get staking transaction at an index from a given block, specified by number.
harmony.hmyv2_getStakingTransactionByBlockHashAn: Get staking transaction at an index from a given block, specified by block hash.
harmony.hmyv2_getStakingTransactionByHash: Get staking transaction by its hash.
harmony.hmyv2_sendRawStakingTransaction: Similar to hmy_sendRawTransaction, but with a staking message field.
harmony.hmyv2_getCurrentTransactionErrorSink: Gets a list of failed transactions currently in the transaction errors sink.
harmony.hmyv2_getTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex: Get transaction at an index from a given block, specified by block hash.
harmony.hmyv2_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndInde: Get transaction at an index from a given block, specified by number.
harmony.hmyv2_getTransactionByHash: Get a transaction by its hash.
harmony.hmyv2_getTransactionReceipt: Get transaction receipt from transaction hash.
harmony.hmyv2_sendRawTransaction: Send a raw transaction encoded in bytes.
harmony.hmyv2_blockNumber: Get number of the most recent block.
harmony.hmyv2_getLeader: Returns one address of current shard leader node
harmony.hmyv2_getShardingStructure: Returns the current shard of the node and lists API and WebSocket endpoints for each shard.
harmony.hmyv2_getValidators: Returns list of validators for a particular epoch in corresponding shard
harmony.hmyv2_getBlocks: Returns blocks in a certain range.
harmony.hmyv2_getBlockByNumber: Get block by its index in the blockchain.
harmony.hmyv2_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber: Get the number of transactions in a block by the block's index in the chain.
harmony.hmyv2_getBlockTransactionCountByHash: Get the number of transactions in a block by the block's hash.
harmony.hmyv2_getHeaderByNumber: Gets the block header data for the specified block number.
harmony.hmyv2_getLatestChainHeaders: Gets a list of the latest beacon chain headers and their related information.
harmony.hmyv2_getBalance: Get latest balance of an address.
harmony.hmyv2_getBalanceByBlockNumber: Get the balance of an address at a given block.
harmony.hmyv2_getStakingTransactionsCount: Gets the number of staking transactions for a ONE wallet address.
harmony.hmyv2_getStakingTransactionsHistory: Get staking transactions history for an address
harmony.hmyv2_getTransactionsCount: Given an account address, returns the number of transactions the account has made.
harmony.hmyv2_getTransactionsHistory: Get transactions history for an address
harmony.hmy_getBalanceByBlockNumber: Get the balance of an address at a given block.
harmony.hmy_getTransactionCount: Given an account address, returns the number of transactions the account has made.
harmony.hmy_getStakingTransactionByBlockHashAndI: Get staking transaction at an index from a given block, specified by block hash.
harmony.hmy_getStakingTransactionByBlockNumberAn: Get staking transaction at an index from a given block, specified by number.
harmony.hmy_getStakingTransactionByHash: Get staking transaction by its hash.
harmony.hmy_getCurrentTransactionErrorSink: Gets a list of failed transactions currently in the transaction errors sink.
harmony.hmy_getPendingCXReceipts: Returns an array of pending cx receipts in tx pool.
harmony.hmy_getCXReceiptByHash: Returns a cx receipt for the provided transaction hash.
harmony.hmy_pendingTransactions: Returns a list of pending transactions.
harmony.hmy_sendRawStakingTransaction: Similar to hmy_sendRawTransaction, but with a staking message field
harmony.hmy_getTransactionsHistory: Returns transactions history for an address
harmony.hmy_sendRawTransaction: Send a raw transaction encoded in bytes.
harmony.hmy_getTransactionReceipt: Get transaction receipt from transaction hash.
harmony.hmy_getBlockTransactionCountByHash: Get the number of transactions in a block by the block's hash.
harmony.hmy_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber: Get the number of transactions in a block by the block's index in the chain.
harmony.hmy_getTransactionByHash: Get a transaction by its hash.
harmony.hmy_getTransactionByBlockNumberAndIndex: Get transaction at an index from a given block, specified by number.
harmony.hmy_getTransactionByBlockHashAndIndex: Get transaction at an index from a given block, specified by block hash.
harmony.hmy_getBlockByNumber: Get block by its index in the blockchain.
harmony.hmy_getBlocks: Returns blocks in a certain range.
harmony.hmy_estimateGas: Generates and returns an estimate of how much gas is necessary to allow the transaction to complete. The transaction will not be added to the blockchain.
harmony.hmy_getStorageAt: Returns the value from a storage position at a given address.
harmony.hmy_call: Executes a new message call immediately without creating a transaction on the block chain.
harmony.hmy_getCode: Get the code at a specific address.
harmony.hmy_getShardingStructure: Returns the current shard of the node and lists API and WebSocket endpoints for each shard.
harmony.hmy_blockNumber: Get number of the most recent block.
harmony.hmy_getLeader: Returns one address of current shard leader node
harmony.hmy_getAllValidatorInformation: Get staking validator information for all validators.
harmony.hmy_getAllValidatorInformationByBlockNum: Get staking validator information snapshot for all validators by blocknum.
harmony.hmy_getDelegationsByValidator: Gets all delegations using the specified ONE address of the validator.
harmony.hmy_getDelegationsByDelegatorAndValidato: Gets all delegations using the specified ONE delegator and validator addresses.
harmony.hmy_getDelegationsByDelegator: Gets a list of delegations for a ONE wallet address.
harmony.hmy_getValidatorMetrics: Returns the metrics for the provided validator address.
harmony.hmy_getCurrentStakingErrorSink: Gets a list of failed transactions currently in the staking errors sink.
harmony.hmy_getValidators: Returns list of validators for a particular epoch in corresponding shard
harmony.hmy_getSignedBlocks: Returns number of blocks out of last 1500 validator has signed
harmony.hmy_isBlockSigner: Returns true if the validator signed a particular block.

nodes-table.empty: There are no nodes to display
nodes-table.tooltip-text: Height, weight and availability of nodes depends on location.

upgrade-banner.message: Faster global infrastructure, WebSockets capability, Dedicated endpoints, Prioritized requests during peak traffic, No request rate limits, & much more.

placeholder.title: Send your request
placeholder.subtitle: Once you start sending requests, your data will be available here. Depending on your usage, you may not have data to show for the past 24 hours or 7 days. This will be populated only if you've made requests in those timeframes.

header.title: Ship fast, Scale and Save with Developer-first pricing
header.sub-title2: Limited-time, developer-first pricing that crushes the competition

basic-plan.title: Public
basic-plan.label: Free
basic-plan.description: Smaller projects and individual developers can receive the best rates of any free tier in the industry.

premium-plan.title: Premium
premium-plan.label: Pay as You Go
premium-plan.description: For Web3 projects looking for fast, reliable infrastructure to scale operations to the next level.
premium-plan.link: Learn more about Pay as You Go

premium-block.title: Please make a deposit to get all Premium features
premium-block.pricing-link: Learn more about Pay as You Go

features-block.feature2: More Requests To Power Your Project
features-block.feature6: Dedicated Endpoints For All Supported Chains
features-block.feature-full1: Provide a constant stream of blockchain data to your application so your applications and platforms can be updated in real-time.
features-block.feature-full2: Scale your application to handle any amount of blockchain requests. Our premium plan serves dApps and platforms of all sizes.
features-block.feature-full3: See all on-chain activity and stay up to date on network activity with our analytics tools.
features-block.feature-full4: Our infrastructure is ready to serve your needs with lightning-fast and reliable returns no matter your location. Ankr removes the need for developers to run their own blockchain nodes, freeing up more time and money to focus on building!
features-block.feature-full5: Ankr Protocol will always prioritize our Premium users to ensure they receive every resource they need to develop and connect with chains.
features-block.feature-full6: Access to dedicated endpoints ensures that your project always has node resources to power it at the highest level of performance.  Build easier on any network with multi-chain infrastructure ready to handle any application’s needs.

body-row.row-3-1: Defaults to 1,500 requests/sec per chain. 4,000 requests/sec for Solana chain. Upgradeable on request.

premium.item-1: Defaults to 1,500 requests/sec per chain. 4,000 requests/sec for Solana chain. Upgradeable on request.

agreement.text: I understand that my wallet app will deposit these tokens and I will incur a gas fee. The deposit is non-refundable. Ankr cannot assist with lost passwords for wallet apps.

validation.checkbox: Please, check this box to proceed

deposit-success.title: Deposited Successfully
deposit-success.subtitle: We need your email so you can receive updates.

pro.title: Congratulations!
pro.subtitle: You have access to all premium features

plan.email-content: For account setup, Ankr needs an email for important notifications and service updates. Don’t worry, your info is highly secured and never shared — use an anonymous address if you wish!

endpoint.title: My endpoints
endpoint.tooltip-text: You have reached the maximum number of endpoints ({limit}).
endpoint.chain-tooltip-text: You don't have an access to add {chainId} endpoint.

delete-dialog.info: Are you sure you’d like to remove {name} endpoint?

security.title: Security
security.tooltip-text: Ensure the integrity of your requests by adding an extra layer of security with the domain (url referer or origin header) and IP address allowlist.

private-endpoints.title: Premium Nodes
private-endpoints.tooltip: Use Premium Endpoint as your main API endpoint for development. Do not use "My Endpoints" directly.

user-endpoints.title: My Endpoints
user-endpoints.tooltip: Will be prioritized ahead of Premium Nodes when serving traffic.

add-endpoint.description: You can import your personal endpoint, which will be used to process requests that are sent to your exclusive ANKR endpoint. In case of an error, the request will be processed by our nodes for premium users. Please enter a valid https endpoint address and the system will check it.

add-step.title: Add your Email
add-step.description: Get 100M Bonus API Credits by adding your email.

success-step.title: Thank you!
success-step.verify-email-text: Please verify email that we sent to {email}

connect-wallet-card.title: Login to see Settings
connect-wallet-card.description: Please, login to see the notification settings.

connect-related-wallet-card.title: Connect Wallet for Related Account
connect-related-wallet-card.description: Connect the wallet associated with your account to view notification settings.

link-expired-card.title: Link Expired
link-expired-card.description: Please re-send a confirmation email to {email}

errors.change-with-same-email: Please use an address that is different from your current one
errors.change-inexistent: Attempting to change the email that hasn't been registered yet
errors.address-pending-other-email-binding: There is an email address already associated with your wallet
errors.too-many-change-email-requests: You can change your email once in {minutes} minute{plural}
errors.too-many-resend-confirmation-requests: You can resend the confirmation email in {minutes} minute{plural}
errors.already-confirmed: The email address {email} has already been registered

balance-updates.title: Balance updates
balance-updates.description: Top ups, withdrawals, voucher credits added, and other updates.

form.marketing: Ankr RPC updates and marketing materials

success-step.verify-email-text: Please verify email that we sent to {email}

new.extra: Top up your balance to use our service.

premium.main: Your premium subscription is active till {date, time, ::dMMMy}.
premium.extra: Then you'll have to Top Up your balance to continue using premium features.

premium-expired.extra: Top up your balance to continue using our service.

payg-active.extra: Enough for {quantifier}{time} {period}, based on your current usage.

payg-inactive.extra: Top up your balance to continue using our service.

payg-warning.extra: Enough for just {quantifier}{time} {period}, based on your current usage.

payg-warning-zero.extra: Based on the current usage, it may not be enough for your needs. Top Up your balance to continue taking full advantage of our service.

payment-table.title: Payments History
payment-table.empty: No data for the selected filter parameters.

card-payment-success.title: Everything looks good!
card-payment-success.description: After Ethereum network validation you will see your updated wallet balance and Premium Endpoints. Usual waiting time is ≈15 min.

card-payment-failure.title: Something going wrong!
card-payment-failure.description: Please try again later or contact our support team.

step-content.0:
• Topping-up requires a gas fee.
  • ANKR calculates into API Credits at ANKR/USD exchange rate on the moment of block’s validation.
step-content.1: Click Confirm and allow us to use your {amount} ANKR in {content}  {name}.
step-content.2: Click Confirm and allow us to spend your {amount} ANKR in {content}  {name}.
step-content.3-error: Oops! Transaction has not been completed.
step-content.4: Finally, click Done and finalise the settings.

step-notice.2: If you changed your mind, click Cancel and give us permission to access your Ankr again so we could revoke your Top Up
step-notice.3: After Ethereum network validation you will see updated balance of your wallet.
step-notice.3-error: Don’t worry, your funds are safe. Just try again.
step-notice.4: The last step in your top up process.

withdraw-steps.title: Withdraw
withdraw-steps.disabled-content: We’ve pegged the price of our API Credits to USD. For now, with regards to withdrawals, it means that they are to be requested via Support only.

step-content.0: I understand my withdrawal could be less after any pending charges are subtracted. The processing time will depend on the Ethereum network load.
step-content.1: How much would you like to withdraw?
step-content.2: Thank you! Transaction is on the way.
step-content.2-error: Oops! Transaction has not been completed.

step-notice.2: After 12 block validations, our system will perform the final calculation. This may take up to 15 minutes
step-notice.2-error: Don’t worry, your funds are safe. Just try again.
step-notice.3: It will take up to 15 minutes for our system to finish the calculation. You can leave this page now.

form.balance-error: You cannot make a withdrawal as your balance is zero or negative
form.min: The minimum withdrawal amount is {value} ANKR
form.max: You cannot make a withdrawal, as your balance is less than {value} ANKR
form.excess: The entered amount exceeds your balance
form.credits-info: Voucher credits are also used for payment. They are equivalent to ordinary credits but cannot be withdrawn in ANKR tokens.

expired-token.text: Your Premium plan’s validity period has expired. Make a deposit (min. 1000 ANKR) to continue using our services under the PAYG charging model. Note that new private endpoints will be generated after making a deposit, so you must add them instead of those currently used in your projects.
